poem:
**A Morning Reimagined**

In a kitchen, light spills
on the memory of coffee—
cups gather, waiting.

Hands meet over
more than java,
brewing hope, beneath
a sky scattered—

with what is given,
with what we share,
this fresh, warm breath
of morning.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian and Macmillan Cancer Support reimagine classic Macmillan Coffee Mornings The Guardian and Macmillan Cancer Support have joined forces to inspire more people to ‘Get together for good’ and raise money for the charity’s annual Coffee Morning, this September. Informed by insights that show the benefit of widening traditional ideas of the event, this year the campaign encourages people to reimagine the classic Macmillan Coffee Morning, and instead host them in their own unique". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
